sections.title: Build a 2D Platformer Game in Unity | Unity Beginner Tutorial

chats.question: Create Project
chats.answer:
1. Install Unity Hub manager
2. Install Unity with optional Visual Studio IDE code editor
3. In Hub Create New Project Button
4. Settings: 2D, name, path
5. Scene is like a level. Kepp 2D btn on for 2d view.
6. Basic Controls:  

    1. Middle mouse button, or Hand btn on - Pan the view
    2. Mouse wheel - zoom
    3. Use Icons (hand, arrows, circle ...) or keys qwerty
    4. Views are dragable and customizable, Top right, layout menu, set default

chats.question: Tilemap
chats.answer:
1. Window -> Asset Store -> Search Online
2. Type 0 $ in filter, find Pixel Adventure 1 in search, Open in Unity
3. In package manager, download, import, keep all selected, import
4. Now files are displayed in unity, go to assets clict show in explorer to see files in file system
5. Select Terrain tiles and set Pixels Per Unit to 16, Sprite Mode to multiple, Sprite editor button, apply  
6. In maximized editor, Slice, Grid by cell size, set 16x16, Slice, Applay (top right), close sprite editor  
7. In hierarchy, add 2d object, tilemap, rectangular, rename to Terrain  
8. Window -> 2d -> Tile Palete; create new palete, Create, select Asset folder
9. Go to Assets find Terrain and drag png on Terrain Palete, create folder Tiles, select it to save tiles there
10. you can now use tiles from Tile Palette to draw on scene
11. Use tools in Tile Pallete (they have icons and keys) to select, move, draw rectangle with selected tiles
12. 12 min
